spirits.name: Vodka
spirits.description: A clear, neutral spirit made from fermented grains or potatoes.

spirits.name: Gin
spirits.description: A spirit flavored with juniper berries and other botanicals.

spirits.name: Rum
spirits.description: A spirit made from sugarcane byproducts, typically aged in barrels.

spirits.name: Tequila
spirits.description: A Mexican spirit made from the blue agave plant.

spirits.name: Whiskey
spirits.description: A distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash.

liqueurs.name: Orange Liqueur
liqueurs.description: An orange-flavored liqueur used in cocktails like the Margarita.

liqueurs.name: Amaretto
liqueurs.description: A sweet liqueur with almond and apricot kernel flavors.

liqueurs.name: Baileys Irish Cream
liqueurs.description: A blend of Irish whiskey and cream, often used in coffee drinks.

liqueurs.name: Campari
liqueurs.description: A bright red, bitter liqueur used in Negronis and spritzes.

liqueurs.name: Coffee Liqueur
liqueurs.description: A sweet coffee-flavored liqueur used in drinks like the White Russian.

syrups.name: Simple Syrup
syrups.description: A basic syrup made from sugar and water, used to sweeten cocktails.

syrups.name: Grenadine
syrups.description: A sweet, red syrup made from pomegranate, used in classics like the Shirley Temple.

syrups.name: Orgeat
syrups.description: A sweet almond syrup with hints of orange blossom, used in Tiki drinks.

syrups.name: Honey Syrup
syrups.description: A diluted honey mix that blends easily into cocktails like the Bee's Knees.

bitters.name: Angostura Bitters
bitters.description: Classic cocktail bitters with a complex herbal flavor.

bitters.name: Orange Bitters
bitters.description: Bitters with a bright orange flavor, used in Martinis and Old Fashioneds.

bitters.name: Peychaud's Bitters
bitters.description: Bright red bitters with a unique flavor profile, essential in a Sazerac.

pantry.name: Salt
pantry.description: Used for rimming glasses or enhancing flavor.

pantry.name: Sugar
pantry.description: Used in cocktails or to make syrups.

pantry.name: Spices
pantry.description: Used to infuse syrups or garnish cocktails.

sodas.name: Club Soda
sodas.description: Plain carbonated water, used in highballs and spritzers.

sodas.name: Tonic Water
sodas.description: Soda with quinine, essential in Gin & Tonic.

sodas.name: Ginger Beer
sodas.description: A strong ginger soda used in Mules and Dark 'n Stormy.

sodas.name: Cola
sodas.description: Used in drinks like the Rum and Coke.

citrus.name: Lime
citrus.description: Used for juice, wedges, or garnish.

citrus.name: Lemon
citrus.description: Used for juice, slices, or peels.

citrus.name: Orange
citrus.description: Used for peels, juice, or twists in many cocktails.

citrus.name: Grapefruit
citrus.description: Used for juice or garnish in bitter and refreshing drinks.

garnishes.name: Lime Wedge
garnishes.description: A small lime slice, commonly used on Margaritas, Mojitos, and Gin & Tonics.

garnishes.name: Lemon Twist
garnishes.description: A thin peel of lemon zest, used to add aroma and visual appeal.

garnishes.name: Orange Slice
garnishes.description: A round slice of orange, used in drinks like the Old Fashioned and Negroni.

garnishes.name: Cocktail Cherry
garnishes.description: Sweet cherries used in Manhattans, Old Fashioneds, and other classic cocktails.

garnishes.name: Olive
garnishes.description: A green or black olive, traditionally served in Martinis.

garnishes.name: Mint Sprig
garnishes.description: A fresh mint sprig adds aroma and freshness, especially in Mojitos and Juleps.

garnishes.name: Cucumber Slice
garnishes.description: Adds a fresh, cool element — common in Pimm's and Gin cocktails.

garnishes.name: Cinnamon Stick
garnishes.description: Used in warm cocktails like Hot Toddies or as a stir stick in spiced drinks.
